content: Mount Everest, the world's highest peak, is part of the Himalayas mountain range and lies on the border between Nepal and which other country?

Mount Everest, the world's highest peak, is indeed part of the Himalayas mountain range. It is located on the border between Nepal and China. The mountain stands at an elevation of 8,848.86 meters (29,031.7 feet) above sea level, making it a significant landmark in both countries. The Nepalese side is in the Solukhumbu district, while the Chinese side is in the Tibet Autonomous Region. Both countries have their own approaches and climbing routes to reach the summit of Everest, attracting mountaineers and adventurers from around the world.
